abstract: BP successfully returned to the bond market five months after its disastrous oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico, selling $3.5 billion in debt.
snippet: BP successfully returned to the bond market five months after its disastrous oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico, selling $3.5 billion in debt.
lead_paragraph: BP successfully returned to the bond market on Tuesday, five months after its disastrous oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico left investors worrying whether the giant energy company could survive the tens of billions of dollars in cleanup costs and liabilities.

headline.main: BP Sells First Debt Since Gulf Oil Spill
